lead_paragraph: A plan to expand higher education to students from impoverished regions, at the expense of the urban middle class, has set off an intense backlash.

byline.contributor: Owen Guo and Vanessa Piao contributed research.

headline.print_headline: China’s Plan for College Spots for the Poor Ignites a Class Conflict
headline.main: China Tries to Redistribute Education to the Poor, Igniting Class Conflict

snippet: A plan to expand higher education to students from impoverished regions, at the expense of the urban middle class, has set off an intense backlash.
abstract: Middle-class parents in over two dozen Chinese cities are protesting government effort to expand access to nation's top colleges for students from less developed regions by admitting fewer students who reside in more prosperous areas; intense backlash, which appears to have taken authorities by surprise, is testing Communist Party's ability to manage class conflict.
